verses.verse: Better <S%H2896><s%> is a poor <S%H7326><s%> man who walks <S%H1980><s%> in his integrity <S%H8537><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> he who <S%H6141><s%> is perverse <S%H6141><s%> in speech <S%H8193><s%> and is a fool. <S%H3684><s%>

Also <S%H1571><s%> it is not good <S%H2896><s%> for a person <S%H5315><s%> to be without <S%H3808><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> And he who makes <S%H213><s%> haste <S%H213><s%> with his feet <S%H7272><s%> errs. <S%H2398><s%>
The foolishness <S%H200><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> subverts <S%H5557><s%> his way, <S%H1870><s%> And his heart <S%H3820><s%> rages <S%H2196><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
Wealth <S%H1952><s%> adds <S%H3254><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> friends, <S%H7453><s%> But a poor <S%H1800><s%> man <S%H1800><s%> is separated <S%H6504><s%> from his friend. <S%H7453><s%>
A false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> will not go <S%H5352><s%> unpunished, <S%H5352><s%> And he who tells <S%H6315><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> will not escape. <S%H4422><s%>

Many <S%H7227><s%> will entreat <S%H9134><s%> the favor <S%H6440><s%> of a generous <S%H5081><s%> man, <S%H5081><s%> And every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H3605><s%> is a friend <S%H7453><s%> to him who gives gifts. <S%H4976><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> the brothers <S%H251><s%> of a poor <S%H7326><s%> man <S%H7326><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> him; How <S%H637><s%> much <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> more <S%H637><s%> do his friends <S%H4828><s%> go <S%H7368><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from him! He pursues <S%H7291><s%> [them with] words, <S%H561><s%> [but] they are gone. <S%H3808><s%>
He who gets <S%H7069><s%> wisdom <S%H3820><s%> loves <S%H157><s%> his own soul; <S%H5315><s%> He who keeps <S%H8104><s%> understanding <S%H8394><s%> will find <S%H4672><s%> good. <S%H9185><s%>
A false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> will not go <S%H5352><s%> unpunished, <S%H5352><s%> And he who tells <S%H6315><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> will perish.

Luxury <S%H8588><s%> is not fitting <S%H5000><s%> for a fool; <S%H3684><s%> Much <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> less <S%H637><s%> for a slave <S%H5650><s%> to rule <S%H4910><s%> over princes. <S%H8269><s%>
A man's discretion <S%H7922><s%> makes <S%H748><s%> him slow <S%H748><s%> to anger, <S%H639><s%> And it is his glory <S%H8597><s%> to overlook <S%H5674><s%> a transgression. <S%H6588><s%>
The king's wrath <S%H2197><s%> is like the roaring <S%H5099><s%> of a lion, <S%H3715><s%> But his favor <S%H7522><s%> is like dew <S%H2919><s%> on the grass. <S%H6212><s%>
A foolish <S%H3684><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> is destruction <S%H1942><s%> to his father, And the contentions <S%H1><s%> of a wife <S%H4066><s%> are a constant <S%H802><s%> dripping. <S%H2956><s%>
House <S%H1004><s%> and wealth <S%H1952><s%> are an inheritance <S%H5159><s%> from fathers, But a prudent <S%H1><s%> wife <S%H7919><s%> is from the Lord. <S%H802><s%>
Laziness <S%H6103><s%> casts <S%H5307><s%> into a deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep, <S%H8639><s%> And an idle <S%H9559><s%> man <S%H5315><s%> will suffer <S%H7456><s%> hunger. <S%H7456><s%>
He who keeps <S%H8104><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> keeps <S%H8104><s%> his soul, <S%H5315><s%> [But] he who is careless <S%H959><s%> of his ways <S%H1870><s%> will die. <S%H4191><s%>

He who is gracious <S%H2603><s%> to a poor <S%H1800><s%> man <S%H1800><s%> lends <S%H9233><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> And He will repay <S%H9608><s%> him for his good <S%H1576><s%> deed. <S%H1576><s%>
Discipline <S%H3256><s%> your son <S%H1121><s%> while <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> is hope, <S%H8615><s%> And do not desire <S%H5375><s%> <S%H5315><s%> his death. <S%H4191><s%>

[A man of] great <S%H1419><s%> anger <S%H2534><s%> shall bear <S%H5375><s%> the penalty, <S%H6066><s%> For if <S%H518><s%> you rescue <S%H5337><s%> [him,] you will only have to do <S%H3254><s%> it again. <S%H3254><s%>
Listen <S%H8085><s%> to counsel <S%H6098><s%> and accept <S%H6901><s%> discipline, <S%H4148><s%> That you may be wise <S%H2449><s%> the rest <S%H319><s%> of your days.
Many <S%H7227><s%> are the plans <S%H4284><s%> in a man's heart, <S%H3820><s%> But the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> it will stand. <S%H6965><s%>

What <S%H8378><s%> is desirable <S%H8378><s%> in a man <S%H120><s%> is his kindness, <S%H2617><s%> And [it is] better <S%H2896><s%> to be a poor <S%H7326><s%> man than <S%H4480><s%> a liar. <S%H376><s%> <S%H3577><s%>

The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> [leads] to life, <S%H9132><s%> So that one may sleep <S%H3885><s%> satisfied, <S%H7649><s%> untouched <S%H1077><s%> <S%H6485><s%> by evil. <S%H9563><s%>

The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> buries <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in the dish, <S%H6747><s%> [And] will not even <S%H1571><s%> bring <S%H7725><s%> it back <S%H7725><s%> to his mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

Strike <S%H5221><s%> a scoffer <S%H9238><s%> and the naive <S%H6612><s%> may become <S%H6191><s%> shrewd, <S%H6191><s%> But reprove <S%H3198><s%> one who has <S%H995><s%> understanding <S%H995><s%> and he will gain <S%H995><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
He who assaults <S%H7703><s%> [his] father [and] drives <S%H1><s%> [his] mother <S%H1272><s%> away <S%H517><s%> Is a shameful <S%H1272><s%> and disgraceful <S%H954><s%> son. <S%H2659><s%>
Cease <S%H2308><s%> listening, <S%H8085><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> to discipline, <S%H4148><s%> [And you will] stray <S%H7686><s%> from the words <S%H561><s%> of knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>

A rascally <S%H1100><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> makes <S%H9238><s%> a mockery <S%H9238><s%> of justice, <S%H4941><s%> And the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> spreads <S%H1104><s%> iniquity. <S%H205><s%>
Judgments <S%H8201><s%> are prepared <S%H3559><s%> for scoffers, <S%H9238><s%> And blows <S%H4112><s%> for the back <S%H1460><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
